sen.j: 刑部省（ぎょうぶしょう）は、律令制下の日本の官制の一つ
sen.e: Gyobu-sho (Ministry of Justice) was a government-regulated organization under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo codes).
sen.cmt: 文が途切れていたので後列より文を移動しました。
sen.e: Gyobu-sho (Ministry of Justice) was a government-regulated organization in Japan under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo codes).
Gyobu-sho (Ministry of Justice) was a government-regulated organization in Japan under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo codes).

sen.j: 明治時代の省庁の一つ
sen.e: Gyobu-sho was also one of central ministries in the Meiji period.
Gyobu-sho was also one of the central ministries in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: one of the central ministriesとしました。
sen.e: Gyobu-sho was also one of the central ministries in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 刑部省（律令制）
sen.e: Gyobu-sho (in the Ritsuryo system)
Gyobu-sho (in the Ritsuryo system)
Gyobu-sho (in the Ritsuryo system)

sen.j: 律令制下の八省の一つ。
sen.e: Gyobu-sho was one of eight central ministries under the Ritsuryo system.
Gyobu-sho was one of the eight central ministries under the Ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: one of the eight central ministriesとしました。
sen.e: Gyobu-sho was one of the eight central ministries under the Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 主な職掌は、司法全般を管轄し重大事件の裁判・監獄の管理・刑罰を執行することである。
sen.e: With administering the entire judicial affairs, Gyobu-sho engaged in the trials of serious incidents, the management of prisons and the execution of punishments.
With administering the entire judicial affairs, Gyobu-sho engaged in the trials of serious incidents, the management of prisons and the execution of punishments.
With administering the entire judicial affairs, Gyobu-sho engaged in the trials of serious incidents, the management of prisons and the execution of punishments.

sen.j: しかし、軽罪については各官司が独自に裁判権を持った。
sen.e: However, as for minor offences, each government official had jurisdiction independently.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, as for minor offences, each government official had jurisdiction independently.
However, as for minor offences, each government official had jurisdiction independently.

sen.j: 平安時代に検非違使が設置されて以降、ほとんどの職掌を検非違使に奪われることとなり、有名無実化した。
sen.e: Since the post of Kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) was provided in the Heian period, the Kebiishi deprived most of the businesses entrusted to Gyobu-sho, with the result that Gyobu-sho became the nominal ministry.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Since the post of Kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) was provided in the Heian period, the Kebiishi deprived most of the businesses entrusted to Gyobu-sho, with the result that Gyobu-sho became the nominal ministry.

Since the post of Kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) was provided in the Heian period, the Kebiishi deprived most of the businesses entrusted to Gyobu-sho, with the result that Gyobu-sho became the nominal ministry.

sen.j: 四等官の他、品官として罪人を裁く判事が設置され、また罪人に対する糾問にあたる解部も設置されていた。
sen.e: Besides Shitokan (four classifications of bureaucrats' ranks), there were additional posts such as Hanji (Judicial Officer) for judging criminals as Honkan (a general term of government posts excluding Shitokan), as well as Tokibe that engaged in interrogating criminals.

Besides Shitokan (four classifications of bureaucrats' ranks), there were additional posts such as Hanji (Judicial Officer) for judging criminals as Honkan (a general term of government posts excluding Shitokan), as well as Tokibe that engaged in interrogating criminals.

Besides Shitokan (four classifications of bureaucrats' ranks), there were additional posts such as Hanji (Judicial Officer) for judging criminals as Honkan (a general term of government posts excluding Shitokan), as well as Tokibe that engaged in interrogating criminals.

sen.j: 判事や解部の部局は刑部省からある程度独立していた。
sen.e: The departments of Hanji and Tokibe were regarded as different departments from Gyobu-sho to some degree.
The departments of Hanji and Tokibe were regarded as different departments from Gyobu-sho to some degree.
The departments of Hanji and Tokibe were regarded as different departments from Gyobu-sho to some degree.

sen.j: 長官である刑部卿は正四位下相当であった。
sen.e: The Gyobu-Kyo, the Secretary of Gyobu-sho, corresponded to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Gyobu-Kyo, the Secretary of Gyobu-sho, corresponded to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
The Gyobu-Kyo, the Secretary of Gyobu-sho, corresponded to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 平忠盛なども任命されたことがある。
sen.e: TAIRA no Tadamori counted among successive Gyobu-Kyo.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: TAIRA no Tadamori counted among successive Gyobu-Kyo.
TAIRA no Tadamori counted among successive Gyobu-Kyo.

sen.j: しかし、従三位以上の公卿が兼帯することも多かった。
sen.e: However, the Kugyo (high court noble) with a rank equivalent to or higher than Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) frequently served as the Gyobu-Kyo concurrently.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the Kugyo (high court noble) with a rank equivalent to or higher than Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) frequently served as the Gyobu-Kyo concurrently.

sen.j: 刑部省（明治時代）
sen.e: Gyobu-sho (in the Meiji period)
Gyobu-sho (in the Meiji period)
Gyobu-sho (in the Meiji period)

sen.j: 明治2年7月8日 (旧暦)（1869年8月15日）、太政官に設置された省庁の一つで、裁判や刑罰の執行、欧米の法令の翻訳などを管轄していた。
sen.e: Gyobu-sho was one of ministries established in Daijokan (Grand Council of State) on August 15, 1869, having authority over trials, execution of punishments, translation of laws and ordinances adopted in Western countries, etc.

Gyobu-sho was one of the ministries established in Dajokan (Grand Council of State) on August 15, 1869, having authority over trials, execution of punishments, translation of laws and ordinances adopted in Western countries, etc.
sen.cmt: one of the ministriesとし、「太政官」→律令制の太政官(daijokan)と区別するためDaijokan→Dajokanとしました。
sen.e: Gyobu-sho was one of the ministries established in Dajokan (Grand Council of State) on August 15, 1869, having authority over trials, execution of punishments, translation of laws and ordinances adopted in Western countries, etc.

sen.j: 明治4年7月9日 (旧暦)（1871年8月24日）に弾正台と合併して司法省と改称された。
sen.e: After combining with Danjodai (Board of Censors) on August 24, 1871, Gyobu-sho was renamed Shiho-sho (Ministry of Justice).
After combining with Danjodai (Board of Censors) on August 24, 1871, Gyobu-sho was renamed Shiho-sho (Ministry of Justice).
After combining with Danjodai (Board of Censors) on August 24, 1871, Gyobu-sho was renamed Shiho-sho (Ministry of Justice).
